The claim refers to the number of pages: which is a daily journal of the U.S. government that contains agency rules, proposed rules, and public notices.
The expert verified the total number of: s term through the date of the statement and found that there were 481,827 pages printed, slightly higher than the claim's figure.
However: it was noted that not all of these pages contained regulations, as the Federal Register also includes notices about agency meetings, public comment periods, presidential documents, and other items that are not considered rules.
The Congressional Research Service: CRS) cautioned that overall page counts in the Federal Register may not accurately represent regulatory activity or the measure of regulatory burden, as many pages have little to do with federal regulations and some rule changes are routine or temporary.
